title: Call_LSI
author: Call_LSI
content: Help me in this journey of knowledge What are the most energy-efficient graphic cards for a mining right now? Is this a good time to start buying graphic cards?Can one person build a mining rig themselves?Ethereum is going away, will Ethereum classic takes is place?

comments.body: Lol you are really something Hub_cat, OP this isn't a good time to start a mining journey for a newbie, have you tried to use some.mining calculators to at least understand how long you can make back your money? comments.author: Coinfarm ventures
comments.body: Better to wait until after the ETH PoS crash or if the bear market continues. GPU prices could be half, meaning you could buy twice as many cards if you're patient. Right now is a horrible time to build a rig, because the recent dip in crypto price hasn't been reflected in used video card markets yet. A RTX 3060L still costs $400+ on feeBay. It should really be $370 or lower.

comments.author: BitSwapNow
comments.body: I have dabbled with mining extensively back in the day. You need to have good reserve's for when markets crash like they are now and also to maintain electricity costs. Graphics cards are at all time high prices because of the demand and also the supply chain crisis of chips and the shortages. With that being said it can still be profitable if you plan to do this in the long run and or have free/cheap electricity. The card will pay itself off eventually and all the crypto will be pure profit minus costs of electric. Use a search for a mining calculator and set it up with something like nicehash. You can mine the most profitable coin and have it auto converted after the day into whatever coin you'd like to hold after/
